programme.title: Round of 16 - Day 9 - Night Session - Beach Volleyball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event tookplace on 01/08/2021 at the Shiokaze Park, Tokyo. It includes Women's Round of 16 match Artacho Del Solar/Clancy (AUS) v Xue/Wang (CHN) and the Men's Round of 16 match Mol/Sorum (NOR ) v Brouwer/Meeuwsen (NED)

programme.title: GER v ARG & AUS v NED - Men's Quarter-Finals - Hockey | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: These matches took place on 01/08/2021 on the North Pitch of the Oi Hockey Stadium, Tokyo. Germany beat Argentina 3:1 and Australia beat Netherlands in the shoot-out after a tie 2:2, to advance to the Semifinals.

programme.title: How Jordan’s Olympic medal turned Ahmad Abughaush into an icon
programme.desc: When Ahmad Abughaush won Jordan’s first-ever Olympic gold medal in 2016, he instantly became an icon for his fellow countrymen.

programme.title: How the “Fighting Lionesses” won Montenegro’s sole Olympic medal
programme.desc: How the women’s handball team won their country’s first-ever Olympic medal in 2012 and became the “Fighting Lionesses” in the process.

programme.title: The Oscar Figueroa story (extended version)
programme.desc: After a severe injury derailed his previous medal hopes, Figueroa put in all on the mat with one final attempt for gold in Rio 2016.

programme.title: Men's 50km Race Walk - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2021 around the Sapporo Odori Park. Tomala (POL) claimed the Gold, Hilbert (GER) Silver and Dunfee (CAN) completed the podium

programme.title: Arriba Cuba
programme.desc: An exploration of the past, present and future of sports in Cuba at a time of unprecedented change.

programme.title: Women's Shot Put Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 01/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Lijiao Gong (CHN) claimed Gold, Raven Saunders (USA) took the Silver and Valerie Adams (NZL) completed the podium

programme.title: Women's Triple Jump Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 01/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Rojas (VEN) claimed the Gold, Mamona (POR) Silver and Peleteiro (ESP) completed the podium

programme.title: The Distance | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The story of an enduring Japanese marathon tradition and a humble champion named Naoko Takahashi who captured her nation’s imagination with a run for the ages at the 2000 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Men's Discus Throw Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event tool place on 31/07/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Stahl (SWE) claimed the Gold, Petterson (SWE) Silver and Weisshaidinger (AUT) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Discus Throw Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 02/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Allman (USA_ claimed the Gold, Pudenz (GER) Silver and Perez (CUB) compleed the podium.

programme.title: Women's Hammer Throw Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Wlodarczyk (POL) claime dthe Gold, Wang (CHN) Silver and Kopron completed the podium

programme.title: Track and Field - Day 12 - Morning Session - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. It includes the Women's 400m Hurdles Final, the Men's Pole Vault Victory Ceremony, the Women's 800m, 400m Hurdles and Hammer Throw Victory Ceremonies, the Men's 110m Hurdles Semifinals, the Men's Javelin Throw Qualifying Round as well as the Women's Heptathlon (100m Hurdles, Hgh Jump) and Men's Decathlon (100m, Long Jump, Shot Put)

programme.desc: Discovering other names, stories and anecdotes behind the mythical Olympic Finals of the 100 meters.

programme.desc: Profiles of what it means to be a first-generation athlete as they try to balance national and personal identities.

programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo.

programme.desc: This event took place on 06/08/2021 around the Sapporo Odori Park. Palmisano (ITA) claimed the Gold, Arenas (COL) Silver and Liu (CHN) completed the podium

programme.title: Anatomy of: Skateboard, Badminton and Athletics
programme.desc: In a sports science lab, we studied the physiques of skateboarder Tom Schaar, badminton player Marcus Ellis, and hurdler and bobsledder Lolo Jones to find our what makes them special at their sports.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Sprinter: The Explosive Powers of Tori Bowie
programme.desc: We took Team USA sprinter and Rio 2016 Gold Medallist Tori Bowie to a science lab and examined her physique to find out what it takes to be a world class champion in short distance running. With the help fellow Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: Track and Field - Day 8 - Evening Session - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event tool place on 31/07/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. It includes the Women's 100m Semifinals and Final, the Mixed 4x400m Relay Final, the Women's 800m Semifinals, the Men's 100m Round 1, the Men's 10000m Victory Ceremony as well as the Men's Discus Throw Final and the Men's Long Jump Qualifying Round.

programme.title: Usain Bolt at 17
programme.desc: Usain Bolt is the greatest sprinter ever but as a hyperactive teenager in Sherwood Content in Jamaica he was not yet plotting Olympic glory.

programme.title: Kirani James at age 17
programme.desc: Grenada's first Olympic champion and medallist Kirani James has lived up to the hype which surrounded him back in his village of Gouyave.

programme.title: Allyson Felix at age 17
programme.desc: Allyson Felix was a humble Los Angeles teenager in 2003, but the American sprint legend was on the verge of becoming a world-class athlete.

programme.title: Veronica Campbell-Brown at age 18
programme.desc: Veronica Campbell-Brown's schooling in her hometown of Clarendon, Jamaica brought discipline and the inspiration to become a sprint legend.

programme.title: Carolina Kluft at age 17
programme.desc: At home in Sweden with heptathlon great Carolina Kluft before she won gold at the 2004 Athens Games.

programme.desc: With hurdles star Liu Xiang in Shanghai when he was 20.

programme.title: Men's Hammer Throw Final - Athletics | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 04/08/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo. Nowicki (POL) claimed the Gold, Henriksen (NOR) Silver and Fajdek (POL) completed the podium

programme.title: The graceful journey of Olympic champion, Jessica von Bredow-Werndl | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Jessica’s dream became reality at Tokyo 2020 with two Olympic Gold medals in dressage in the individual and team event. But her incredible bond with her horse, Dalera, is forged by hard work and an implacable discipline at Aubenhausen world-class riding centre. With her title back on the line at Paris 2024, she opens the doors of her family estate and reflects, with her family and her team, on an emotional journey full of joy and determination.

programme.title: CAN v ROC - Men's Quarter-Final - Volleyball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Men's Quarterfinal Match between Canada and ROC took place on 03/08/2021 at the Ariake Arena, Tokyo. Final Score ROC 3:0 CAN

programme.title: CAN v USA & ESP v CHN - Women's Quarter-Finals - Water Polo | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: These Women's Quarterfinal Matches were played on 03/08/2021 at the Tatsumi Water Polo Centre, Tastumi.

programme.title: FRA v BRN - Men's Quarter-Final - Handball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This Men's Quarterfinal Match took place on 03/08/2021 at the Yoyogi National Stadium, Tokyo. Final Score FRA 42:28 BRN

programme.title: GER v USA & BRA v SUI - Women's Quarter-Finals - Beach Volleyball | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event tookplace on 03/08/2021 at the Shiokaze Park, Tokyo. It includes the Women's Quarterfinal Matches Ludwig/Kozuch (GER) v April/Alix (USA) and Ana Patricia/Rebecca (BRA) v Verge-Depre/Heidrich (SUI)

programme.title: The graceful journey of Olympic champion, Jessica von Bredow-Werndl | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Jessica’s dream became reality at Tokyo 2020 with two Olympic Gold medals in dressage in the individual and team event. But her incredible bond with her horse, Dalera, is forged by hard work and an implacable discipline at Aubenhausen world-class riding centre. With her title back on the line at Paris 2024, she opens the doors of her family estate and reflects, with her family and her team, on an emotional journey full of joy and determination.

programme.title: French kiteboarding prodigee on her way to gold at Paris | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Lauriane Nolot, the current world champion, aims for Gold at Paris 2024 on the shores of Marseille where Formula Kite will make its Olympic debut. Hailing from Camps-la-Source, an hour away from the Olympic venue, she climbs the ranks with determination from family get-aways to world podium. Her impressive journey propels her to the pinnacle of her sport, ready to shine on the Olympic stage.

programme.title: France's Sevens captain targets gold at Paris 2024 | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Backed by a great team and high perfornming coaches, Carla's quest for Olympic gold symbolizes the rise of women's rugby since Rio 2016. From competing with boys to leading her nation to Silver in Tokyo 2020, the French rugby Seven squad’s captain inspires resilience and dedication on the road to Paris 2024.

programme.title: Semi-Finals & Finals - Day 11 - Canoe Sprint | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Sea Forrest waterway, Tokyo. It includes the Women's Kayak Single 200m, the Women's Kayak Double 500m , the Men's Kayak Single 1000m and Men's Canoe Double 1000m Finals as well as their Victory Ceremonies.

programme.title: Ezra: A high-jumper finds community and another chance | The Starting Line
programme.desc: As high-jump reigning World Champion, Ezra Frech prepares to return to the Paralympics for the second time. He reflects on his remarkable journey with his father and together with his mother, he takes us to meet their wider and beloved Californian community as they organize a unique event for adaptative sports in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Ferdinand: The Beast from the East returns to his roots | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Known as the ‘Fastest Man in Africa’ for his prowess in the 100m, Ferdinand Omanyala is setting his sights on becoming the fastest man in the world at Paris 2024. We follow him as he travels back to his hometown of Kitale in Kenya to get the blessings he needs from his peers and uncover the remarkable story of his origins.

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Carlota: Proving herself and her sport to the world | The Starting Line
programme.desc: A young female breaker for France, Carlota Dudek is training to qualify for the Olympics to showcase her unique style to the world, inherited from her mother Cuban origin. We travel with her from Paris to her hometown in the heart of Provence where her life-long dance journey began.

programme.title: Manon: How the bond with her horse changed her life | The Starting Line
programme.desc: Two-time medallist in dressage at Tokyo 2020, Manon Claeys shares her inspiring journey back from severe injury to Paralympic podium. After her accident, she thought she would never ride a horse again. Now, together with her cherished horse Katarina, and surrounded by her team and family, she trains to achieve a gold medal at Paris 2024.

programme.title: Duets Technical Routine - Artistic Swimming | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 03/08/2021 at the Tokyo Aquatics Centre, Tokyo. Kolesnichenko/ Romashina (ROC) lead the field into the Free Routine.

But her incredible bond with her horse, Dalera, is forged by hard work and an implacable discipline at Aubenhausen world-class riding centre. With her title back on the line at Paris 2024, she opens the doors of her family estate and reflects, with her family and her team, on an emotional journey full of joy and determination.

Hailing from Camps-la-Source, an hour away from the Olympic venue, she climbs the ranks with determination from family get-aways to world podium. Her impressive journey propels her to the pinnacle of her sport, ready to shine on the Olympic stage.
